name: O. C. Cotten
description: Dark Velvet Red. Medium to large, semidouble with very large petals and large crown of Pink stamens and Yellow anthers containing one to three petaloids. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1955 - R. B. Ching, McComb, MS).

name: O. C. Cotten Variegated
description: Dark Velvet Red blotched White variation of 'O C Cotten.'.

name: O. K. Bowman
description: Orange Red to Orange Red blotched White. Medium to large, semidouble to anemone form with White stamens. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1957 - Bowman).

name: Oaso
description: Light Rose Pink variegated White. Large, single with flared White stamens which in some flowers are partially topped with Pinkish White petaloids. See Higo.

name: Obliging
description: White flecked Red. Large, semidouble, peony, etc. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1956 - J. S. Gilder, San Fernando, CA).

name: Ocean Springs
description: White with wide Red border. Small, single.

name: October Affair
description: Light Pink with Deep Pink outer petals. Medium, formal double. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1981 - Parks).

name: October Delight
description: See 'Marie Bracey'.

name: October Joy
description: Deep Wine Red. Medium, loose peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (U.S. 1940 - Gerbing).

name: October Magic Bride
description: ('Green 99-096'). White. Small to medium, loose peony. Dense, semi-dwarf conical growth. E-M. (U.S. 1999 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Carpet
description: ('Green 01-006'). Bright Pink with Yellow anthers and Yellow filaments. Medium, semidouble with ruffled petals. Average, dense, spreading, low growth, E-M. (U.S. 2001 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Crimson N' Clover
description: Deep Crimson-Red flowers with Gold anthers and Reddish filaments. Medium to large, single. Vigorous, upright growth E-M. (Seedling of Sasanqua 'October Magic Rose'). (U.S. 2021 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Dawn
description: ('Green 99-012'). Soft Peach Pink. Medium to large, rose form double to peony form. Dense, conical to pyramidal growth. E-M. (U.S. 1999 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Inspiration
description: ('Green 97-039'). White with Pinkish-Violet edges. Medium, peony form. (Sasanqua 'Mine-no-yuki' seedling). (U.S. 1997- Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Ivory
description: ('Green 99-016'). White. Medium, semidouble to loose peony form with ruffled petals. Vigorous, bushy, upright growth. E-M. (Sasanqua 'Mine-No-Yuki' seedling). (U.S. 1999 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Orchid
description: (Green 94-035'). Varying tones of White and Orchid Pink. Small to medium, semidouble. Dense, semi-dwarf growth. E-M. (U.S. 2000 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Pink Perplexion
description: ('Green 01-006'). Soft Pink. Medium, rose form double. Average, bushy, spreading, rounded growth. E-M. (U.S. 2001 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Rose
description: ('Green 98-009'). Coral Red. Small, peony form. Columnar growth. E-M. (U.S. 1999 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Ruby
description: ('Green 02-003'). Red. Small to medium, peony form. Dense, semi-dwarf growth. E-M. (U.S. 2002 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: October Magic Snow
description: ('Green 94-010'). White, often edged in Pink and a Pink cast appearing in the center. Medium, peony form; medium rounded form. (Sasanqua 'Mine-no-yuki' seedling). E-M. (U.S. 1994 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL). OCTOBER MAGIC WHITE SHI-SHI - Porcelain White. Medium, formal double. Average, bushy, spreading growth. E-L. (Seedling of Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' x Sasanqua). (U.S. 2021 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Ode Of Edgewood
description: Bright Red. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Average, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1967 - Maj. R. F. Hightower, Ocala, FL).

name: Odoratissima
description: ('La Graciola'). Rose Pink. Large, semidouble to peony form. Upright growth. M-L. Slightly fragrant. (For another form of this cultivar see 'Leverton's'). (Aus. 1866 - Guilfoyle).

name: Ogi-No-Mine
description: White. Medium, single with flared White stamens. See Higo.

name: Oh Boy
description: Purplish Pink. Large, formal double, sometimes with cupped petals. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1965 - J. F. Marscher, Beaufort, SC).

name: Oh-Zora
description: Light Pink. Medium, single with circular White stamens. See Higo.

name: Ohkan
description: White with Rose Red border. Medium, single with flare stamens. Slow, compact growth. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Yamato Nishiki'). See Higo.

name: Ohn Holliman
description: Dark Pink. Medium, anemone form. Average dense, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 1992 - J. Holliman, Thomaston, GA). semidouble; the petaloids divert the stamens. Vigorous, upright growth. M- L. (U.S. 2014 - Catherine Johnson, Perry, GA).

name: Oki-No-Nami
description: Pink edged White with Dark Red stripes. Large, semidouble. (Japan 1710 - Kantô area.

name: Okke's Delight
description: Pink. Small, anemone form.

name: Old Faithful
description: Deep Pink to Pale Mauve Pink. Medium, semidouble to loose peony form.

name: Old Glory
description: White with Dark Pink edging with Golden anthers and Yellow filaments. Medium, wide open single to semidouble with sprayed stamens and ruffed petals. Upright growth. (U.S. 2009 - Nuccio's).

name: Old Ivory
description: Cream White. Medium, full peony form. (U.S. 1959 - O. H. Johnson, Hattiesburg, MS).

name: Old Prints
description: Bright Red to White striped Red. Small, flat formal double with tight rows of recurring petals. Dwarf growth. E. (U.S. 1972 - Witman).

name: Ole Miss
description: Pale Pink. Medium to large, semidouble with crepe petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1967 - Miss R. N. Campbell, Mobile, AL).

name: Olga Leach
description: Pale Pink and White with Deeper Pink on outer one fourth of petals shading to almost White on inner one-third of petals. Medium, semidouble with loose petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1958 - Fisher).

name: Olguita
description: Pink shading to White on the petals in varying degrees with Gold anthers and Yellow filaments. Small, semidouble. Average, upright, dense growth. E-L. (Non-reticulata hybrid 'Yume' x Sasanqua) x (unknown Sasanqua). (U.S. 2018 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Olive Barrett
description: Rose Pink with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Medium, irregular semidouble with stamens mixed with petals. Slow, pendulous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1950 - Clower).

name: Olive Elizabeth
description: Carmine. Medium, loose peony form. Vigorous, compact growth. E-M. (U.S. 1950 - Clower).

name: Olive Honnor
description: Crimson. Very large, anemone form. Average, upright growth. M. (N.Z. 1976 - Mrs. O. Honnor, New Plymouth).

name: Olive Lee Shepp
description: White marked Deep Red. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. ('Variation of this cultivar include 'Arlene Lee Shepp'; 'Raymond Beals'). (U.S. 1948 - Shepp).

name: Olivia
description: White. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1969 - G. R. Howard, Charlotte, NC).

name: Olivia Mary
description: Red, Small, formal double with incurved petals. Average, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 2019 - Bill Lang, Fort Walton Beach, FL).

name: Ollie Mack
description: White with Faint Blush Pink with a Yellow cast in center with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, full peony form. Average, upright, open growth. M. (U.S. 2021 - Don Bergamini, Martinez, CA).

name: Omega
description: Blush White edged Coral. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1965 - Wilson).

name: Omega Red
description: Light Red with Red and White petaloids with heavy petal texture. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1994 - Jerry Hogsette, Gainesville, FL).

name: Omigoromo (Beautiful Kimono)
description: Soft Pink toned slightly lighter near center with Dark Yellow anthers and Light Yellow filaments. Small to medium, single, slightly cupped. Average, upright, somewhat arching growth.

name: One Alone
description: Blush Pink. Large, loose peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1961 - Ashby).

name: One Second
description: Rose Red (RHS color 58c) with a slight Purplish cast with Rose Red (RHS color 58c) with a slight Purplish cast anthers and White filaments. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. L. (U.S. 2018 - Auburn-Opelika Men's Camellia Club, Auburn, AL).

name: Onetia Holland
description: White. Large to very large, loose peony form. Average, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1954 - J. A. Holland, Upland, CA).

name: Oniji
description: ('Lady Clare Variegated'; 'Empress Variegated'; 'Mrs. H L. Windbigler'). Deep Pink marbled White. Large, semidouble. (Variegated variation of 'Lady Clare'). (Japan 1935 - Chugai).

name: Oninski
description: White shading to Pink at edges with Gold anthers and White filaments. Small, single. E.

name: Oo-La-La!
description: Pink striped Red and edged White, occasionally mottled White. Medium, single to semidouble. Average, upright growth. E- L. (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Ay-Ay-Ay!'). (U.S. 1991 - Nuccio's).

name: Opal Hearne
description: Oriental Red. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular petals to loose peony form. (U.S. 1968 - H. C. Hearne, Ruston, LA).

name: Opal Princess
description: Blush Pink. Medium, formal double. Average, dense, upright growth. M-L. (Japonica 'Berenice Boddy' × Hybrid 'Mona Jury'). (N.Z. 1991- Jury).

name: Ophelia Dent
description: Delicate Pink. Medium, semidouble. (U.S. 1956 - Miss M Dent, Brunswick, GA)

name: Orandakô (Holland Red)
description: Deep Pink striped White. Small, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (Japan 1733 - Chikinshô Furoku).

name: Optical Illusion
description: Yellow with Pink overtones. Medium, formal double with strap-like petals that can be arranged in a somewhat spiral pattern. (Flava x Japonica). (U.S. 2015 - Parks).

name: Orchid Beauty
description: Light Orchid Pink, edged Deeper Pink. Medium to large, formal double form. Average, open and upright growth. (U.S. 2002 - Nuccio's).

name: Orchid Mist
description: Soft Orchid with soft Gold anthers and Cream filaments. Small to medium, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (U.S. 2013 - Gordy).

name: Orchid Pink
description: Light Pink center petals with considerable Orchid, bordered rich Pink and sometimes spotted White. Medium, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica 'Colonial Lady'). (U.S. 1939 - Carter).

name: Orchid Princess
description: Pale Orchid Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis seedling). (U.S. 1987 - Nuccio's).

name: Oriental Echo
description: Clear Pink with misty Silver overcast and center petals moired and edged White. Medium to large, formal double to rose form double with petals rounded at edge, slightly notched and waved, and small, upright center petals. Upright, pendulous growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' seedling). (U.S. 1968 - C. W. Lattin, Lauderdale, MS)

name: Osmanthus Leaf Carmine
description: ('Guiye Yanghong' - Chinese Name). Carmine. Large to very large, semidouble with wavy, upright petals. E. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1980 - U. C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

name: Osakazuki
description: ('Taihai'). See 'Daitairin'.

name: Osaki
description: Light Pink to White. Medium, semidouble.

name: Osaraku
description: Light Pink. Medium, single with flared Pale Yellow stamens which in some flowers are partially topped with soft Pink petaloids. See Higo.

name: Oscar B. Elmer
description: Dark Velvet Red. Large, semidouble. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1978 - Mandarich).

name: Ota-Haku
description: White. Small to medium, single. See Higo.

name: Otahuhu Beauty
description: ('Aspasia Rosea'; 'Duke of York'; 'Paeoniaeflora Rosea'). Rose Pink. Medium, full peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Aspasia Macarthur'). (N.Z. 1904 - Lippiatt, Otahuhu).

name: Otara Rose
description: Phlox Pink. Very large, semidouble. Compact, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis × Reticulata 'Captain Rawes'). (N.Z. 1958 - Doak).

name: Otha Shaffer
description: Orchid to Deep Pink. Medium, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, spreading growth. E-L. (U.S. 1999 - Otha Shaffer, Madison, FL).

name: Otohime
description: Rose Pink often blotched White. Small, single. Medium, upright, compact growth. E-M.

name: Otome Red
description: See 'Monjisu Red'.

name: Otome Variegated
description: See 'Baronne De Bleichroeder (United States)

name: Otome White
description: ('Bleichroeder White'; 'Mrs. Helen Reynolds'). White variation of 'Baronne De Bleichroeder. M. (U.S. 1935).'.

name: Otome-Shibori
description: See 'Baronne De Bleichroeder (United States)'.

name: Otto Hopfer
description: Light Red. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Japonica 'Lotus'). (U.S. 1970 - D. Hopfer, San Francisco, CA).

name: Our Betty
description: Light Pink. Medium to large, tulip form semidouble with two distinct rows of long slim petals. Upright growth. M. (U.S. 1982 - Kramer).

name: Our Betty Variegated
description: Light Pink and White variation of 'Our Betty'. (N.Z. 1988).

name: Our Bill
description: White Blush. Large, semidouble form. Average, dense, upright growth. M. (U.S. 2004 - Howard Smith, Gainesville, FL).

name: Our Granddaughters
description: Raspberry Pink, shading deeper on the petals' edges. Very large, semidouble form. Open, upright growth. E- L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Wild Form' x Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' x Nitidissima). (Aus. 2005 - Colleen Sherrington, Balwyn North, Vic.).

name: Our Julia
description: Deep Pink. Large, semidouble with fluted petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1964).

name: Our Kerry
description: Deep veined Red. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata hybrid 'Jean Pursel'). (U.S. 1980 - Pursel).

name: Our Kim
description: Pink to Neyron Rose. Large, peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' x Reticulata hybrid 'Jean Pursel'). (Aus. 1996 - Dr. R. Withers, Donvale, Vic.).

name: Our Linda
description: Pink. Medium, rose form double.

name: Our Melissa
description: Pink. Small, anemone form. Vigorous, weeping growth. E-L. (Pitardii seedling). (Aus. 1986 - Sebire).

name: Our Nancy
description: White with an occasional Light Pink stripe. Medium to large, semidouble form. Slow, dense, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1999 - Dr. Howard Smith, Gainesville, FL).

name: Our Selection
description: Dark Pink to Red. Very large, peony form. Open, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Lion Head' seedling). (Aus. 1984 - Sebire)

name: Ovate Leaf Pink
description: ('Luanye Yinhong' - Chinese Name). Light Pink shaded deeper in center. Large to very large, semidouble. E. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1980 - U. C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

name: Ovation
description: Mauve Pink. Large, semidouble. Rapid, bushy, compact, upright growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Overture' seedling). (Aus. 2006 - Norm Prentice, Garfield, Vic.).

name: Over Navarro
description: Silvery Light Pink. Large, semidouble to rose form double. Strong, well-branched growth. M. [(Pitardii var. 'Yunnanica' × Reticulata hybrid 'Forty-Niner') x Hybrid 'Coral Delight']. (U.S. 2009 - Gordy).

name: Overlook White
description: ('Late White Empress'). White. Large, semidouble with fluted petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1961 - Overlook).

name: Overture
description: Bright Red. Very large, semidouble with upright petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' seedling). (Aus. 1971 - Tuckfield).

name: Owen Henry
description: Light Orchid Pink with Strawberry undertones. Large, anemone form. (Sport of Japonica 'Sunset Glory'). (U.S. 1964 - Short).

name: Oyler's "dr. O"
description: Rich Red Burgundy with Golden anthers and Cream filaments. Medium, semidouble form with very pronounced stamens. Slow, upright, open growth. L. (U.S. 2021 - Donald R. Oyler, Mobile, AL).

name: Oyler's Carolyn Marie Variegated
description: Red with White splotches with Gold anthers. Medium, semidouble. Slow, upright, open growth. M. (U.S. 2010 - Donald R. Oyler, Mobile, AL).

name: Oyler's Christina Marie
description: White. Medium, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 2010 - Donald R. Oyler, Mobile, AL).

name: Oyler's King David
description: Dark Rich Burgundy. Medium, formal double form. Slow, compact, medium density growth. M. (U.S. 2021 - Donald R. Oyler, Mobile, AL).

name: Oyler's Rachel Marie
description: Light Pink with Deeper Pink on the underside of the petals with Gold anthers. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 2010 - Donald R. Oyler, Mobile, AL).

name: Oyler's Sydney
description: Fuchsia and White with Golden anthers and Cream filaments. Medium, full peony. Slow, upright, dense growth. M-L. (U.S. 2014 - Donald R. Oyler, Mobile, AL).

name: Oza Shirah
description: Light Pink, feathering to White on edges of petals. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, spreading and upright growth. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Borom's Gem'). (U.S. 2005 - John W. Shirah, Lakeland, FL).

name: Ozeki
description: Rose Pink. Large, single with soft Pink stamens which in some flowers are partially topped with soft Pink and White petaloids. See Higo.
